N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7313.7 - Confidentiality and disclosure of youth medical and mental health records

State Regulations
(a) Each facility
shall adhere to the requirements of Part 7310 of this Title, Article 27-F of
the Public Health Law, Article 33 of the Mental Hygiene Law, all applicable

Department of Health regulations and Part 180-3 of this Title to ensure the
confidentiality of a youth's medical, mental health, and facility
records. (b) The director shall
make provisions for maintaining all medical and mental health records in
confidential files, separate from other youth facility records. (c) Except as otherwise prohibited or
restricted by law, the facility medical director and/or mental health
supervisory staff shall promptly disclose to the director, or designee, information received concerning a youth which is or may be relevant in
determining the youth's risk, security and supervision and special needs
requirements, or may affect the life, safety, or welfare of the youth or any
other person. The director, or designee, shall then promptly disclose such
information to the appropriate staff responsible for making classification, assessment, and/or reassessment decisions. Notes
